I would like to see him simply say what he said during the campaign... that he will not support cuts, raising the retirement age, or in any case privatization. Sen. Sherrod Brown ( D-OH) thinks exigent circumstances muted Barack Obama to some extent, but that he'll pick up his game when confronted with a juggernaut of conservative support for gutting the program.

As the Financial Crisis Inquiry Commission just reported, the Fed "was a pivotal failure" at stemming "the flow of toxic mortgages." Moreover, the report concludes the Federal Reserve "neglected" its mission to ensure the safety and soundness of the nation's banking system and to "protect the credit rights of consumers."
